page.title: 08Education-schools
page.content: The present{Hemingbrough Primary {School}was built in 1963.Today the school has 155 children spread through 5 classes.The school is run by the Headmaster Mr Butterworth and his teaching staff of 5 teachers and several helpers.Shortly the school is to be expanded to cater for the growing population. In{Cliffe}a new{Primary School}was built in 1981 to replace the 19th century building which stood next to the railway line.Cliffe school has 3 classes. At Hemingbrough we play a lot of sport and go on many day and residential visits. {Cliffe}and{Hemingbrough}have {pre-school playgroups. For secondary and tertiary education students travel to Selby and Barlby. There is an R.C.High School at Carlton
